verses.verse: Then <WG2532> the whole <WG537> body <WG4128> of them arose <WG450> and brought <WG71> Him before <WG1909> Pilate. <WG4091>

And they began <WG757> to accuse <WG2723> Him, saying, <WG3004> "We found <WG2147> this <WG3778> man <WG3778> misleading <WG1294> our nation <WG1484> and forbidding <WG2967> to pay <WG1325> taxes <WG5411> to Caesar, <WG2541> and saying <WG3004> that He Himself <WG1438> is Christ, <WG5547> a King. <WG935>"
And Pilate <WG4091> asked <WG2065> Him, saying, <WG3004> "Are You the King <WG935> of the Jews <WG2453>?" And He answered <WG611> him and said, <WG5346> "[It is as] you say. <WG3004>"
And Pilate <WG4091> said <WG3004> to the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and the multitudes, <WG3793> "I find <WG2147> no <WG3762> guilt <WG159> in this <WG3778> man. <WG444>"

But they kept on insisting, <WG2001> saying, <WG3004> "He stirs <WG383> up the people, <WG2992> teaching <WG1321> all <WG3650> over <WG2596> Judea, <WG2453> starting <WG757> from Galilee, <WG1056> even as far <WG2193> as this <WG5602> place. <WG5602>"
But when Pilate <WG4091> heard <WG191> it, he asked <WG1905> whether <WG1487> the man <WG444> was a Galilean. <WG1057>

And when he learned <WG1921> that He belonged <WG1510> <WG1537> to Herod <WG2264>'s jurisdiction, <WG1849> he sent <WG375> Him to Herod, who himself <WG846> also <WG2532> was in Jerusalem <WG2414> at that time. <WG2250>

Now <WG1161> Herod <WG2264> was very <WG3029> glad <WG5463> when he saw <WG3708> Jesus; <WG2424> for he had <WG1510> wanted <WG2309> to see <WG3708> Him for a long <WG2425> time, <WG5550> because <WG1223> he had been hearing <WG191> about <WG4012> Him and was hoping <WG1679> to see <WG3708> some <WG5100> sign <WG4592> performed <WG1096> by Him.
And he questioned <WG1905> Him at some <WG2425> length <WG3056>; <WG2425> but He answered <WG611> him nothing. <WG3762>
And the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and the scribes <WG1122> were standing <WG2476> there, accusing <WG2723> Him vehemently. <WG2159>

And Herod <WG2264> with his soldiers, <WG4753> after treating <WG1848> Him with contempt <WG1848> and mocking <WG1702> Him, dressed <WG4016> Him in a gorgeous <WG2986> robe <WG2066> and sent <WG375> Him back <WG375> to Pilate. <WG4091>

Now <WG1161> Herod <WG2264> and Pilate <WG4091> became <WG1096> friends <WG5384> with one <WG240> another <WG240> that very <WG846> day; <WG2250> for before <WG4391> they had been <WG4391> <WG1510> at enmity <WG2189> with each <WG848> other. <WG848>
And Pilate <WG4091> summoned <WG4779> the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and the rulers <WG758> and the people, <WG2992>

and said <WG3004> to them, "You brought <WG4374> this <WG3778> man <WG444> to me as one who incites <WG654> the people <WG2992> to rebellion, <WG654> and behold, <WG2400> having examined <WG350> Him before <WG1799> you, I have found <WG2147> no <WG3762> guilt <WG159> in this <WG3778> man <WG444> regarding the charges <WG2723> which <WG3739> you make <WG2723> against <WG2596> Him.

"No, <WG235> nor <WG3761> has Herod, <WG2264> for he sent <WG375> Him back <WG375> to us; and behold, <WG2400> nothing <WG3762> deserving <WG514> death <WG2288> has been <WG1510> done <WG4238> by Him.
"I will therefore <WG3767> punish <WG3811> Him and release <WG630> Him."
[Now <WG1161> he was obliged <WG2192> <WG318> to release <WG630> to them at the feast <WG1859> one <WG1520> prisoner.]
But they cried <WG349> out all <WG3826> together, <WG3826> saying, <WG3004> "Away <WG142> with this <WG3778> man, <WG3778> and release <WG630> for us Barabbas! <WG912>"
(He was one <WG3748> who <WG3748> had been thrown <WG906> into prison <WG5438> for a certain <WG5100> insurrection <WG4714> made <WG1096> in the city, <WG4172> and for murder. <WG5408>)
And Pilate, <WG4091> wanting <WG2309> to release <WG630> Jesus, <WG2424> addressed <WG4377> them again, <WG3825>
but they kept on calling <WG2019> out, saying, <WG3004> "Crucify, <WG4717> crucify <WG4717> Him!"

And he said <WG3004> to them the third <WG5154> time, <WG5154> "Why, <WG1063> what <WG5101> evil <WG2556> has this <WG3778> man <WG3778> done <WG4160>? I have found <WG2147> in Him no <WG3762> guilt <WG159> [demanding] death; <WG2288> I will therefore <WG3767> punish <WG3811> Him and release <WG630> Him."
But they were insistent, <WG1945> with loud <WG3173> voices <WG5456> asking <WG154> that He be crucified. <WG4717> And their voices <WG5456> [began] to prevail. <WG2729>
And Pilate <WG4091> pronounced <WG1948> sentence <WG1948> that their demand <WG155> should be granted. <WG1096>

And he released <WG630> the man they were asking <WG154> for who had been thrown <WG906> into prison <WG5438> for insurrection <WG4714> and murder, <WG5408> but he delivered <WG3860> Jesus <WG2424> to their will. <WG2307>

And when <WG5613> they led <WG520> Him away, <WG520> they laid <WG1949> hold <WG1949> of one <WG5100> Simon <WG4613> of Cyrene, <WG2956> coming <WG2064> in from the country, <WG68> and placed <WG2007> on him the cross <WG4716> to carry <WG5342> behind <WG3693> Jesus. <WG2424>
And there were following <WG190> Him a great <WG4183> multitude <WG4128> of the people, <WG2992> and of women <WG1135> who <WG3739> were mourning <WG2875> and lamenting <WG2354> Him.

But Jesus <WG2424> turning <WG4762> to them said, <WG3004> "Daughters <WG2364> of Jerusalem, <WG2419> stop <WG3361> weeping <WG2799> for Me, but weep <WG2799> for yourselves <WG1438> and for your children. <WG5043>

"For behold, <WG2400> the days <WG2250> are coming <WG2064> when <WG1722> <WG3739> they will say, <WG3004> 'Blessed <WG3107> are the barren, <WG4723> and the wombs <WG2836> that never <WG3756> bore, <WG1080> and the breasts <WG3149> that never <WG3756> nursed. <WG5142>'
"Then <WG5119> they will begin <WG757> to say <WG3004> to the mountains, <WG3735> 'Fall <WG4098> on us,' and to the hills, <WG1015> 'Cover <WG2572> us.'
" For if <WG1487> they do <WG4160> these <WG3778> things <WG3778> in the green <WG5200> tree, <WG3586> what <WG5101> will happen <WG1096> in the dry <WG3584>?"
And two <WG1417> others <WG2087> also, <WG2532> who were criminals, <WG2557> were being led <WG71> away <WG71> to be put <WG337> to death <WG337> with Him.

And when <WG3753> they came <WG2064> to the place <WG5117> called <WG2564> The Skull, <WG2898> there <WG1563> they crucified <WG4717> Him and the criminals, <WG2557> one <WG3739> on the right <WG1188> and the other <WG3739> on the left. <WG710>

But Jesus <WG2424> was saying, <WG3004> "Father, <WG3962> forgive <WG863> them; for they do not know <WG3609> what <WG5101> they are doing. <WG4160>" And they cast <WG906> lots, <WG2819> dividing <WG1266> up His garments <WG2440> among <WG1266> themselves.

And the people <WG2992> stood <WG2476> by, looking <WG2334> on. And even <WG2532> the rulers <WG758> were sneering <WG1592> at Him, saying, <WG3004> "He saved <WG4982> others; <WG243> let Him save <WG4982> Himself <WG1438> if <WG1487> this <WG3778> is the Christ <WG5547> of God, <WG2316> His Chosen <WG1588> One. <WG1588>"
And the soldiers <WG4757> also <WG2532> mocked <WG1702> Him, coming <WG4334> up to Him, offering <WG4374> Him sour <WG3690> wine, <WG3690>
and saying, <WG3004> "If <WG1487> You are the King <WG935> of the Jews, <WG2453> save <WG4982> Yourself! <WG4572>"
Now <WG1161> there was also <WG2532> an inscription <WG1923> above <WG1909> Him, "THIS <WG3778> IS THE KING <WG935> OF THE JEWS. <WG2453>"

And one <WG1520> of the criminals <WG2557> who were hanged <WG2910> [there] was hurling <WG987> abuse <WG987> at Him, saying, <WG3004> "Are You not the Christ <WG5547>? Save <WG4982> Yourself <WG4572> and us!"

But the other <WG2087> answered, <WG611> and rebuking <WG2008> him said, <WG5346> "Do you not even <WG3761> fear <WG5399> God, <WG2316> since <WG3754> you are under <WG1722> the same <WG846> sentence <WG2917> of condemnation <WG2917>?

"And we indeed <WG3303> justly, <WG1346> for we are receiving <WG618> what <WG3739> we deserve <WG514> for our deeds <WG3739>; <WG4238> but this <WG3778> man <WG3778> has done <WG4238> nothing <WG3762> wrong. <WG824>"
And he was saying, <WG3004> "Jesus, <WG2424> remember <WG3403> me when <WG3752> You come <WG2064> in Your kingdom! <WG932>"
And He said <WG3004> to him, "Truly <WG281> I say <WG3004> to you, today <WG4594> you shall be with Me in Paradise. <WG3857>"

And it was now <WG2235> about <WG5616> the sixth <WG1623> hour, <WG5610> and darkness <WG4655> fell <WG1096> over <WG1909> the whole <WG3650> land <WG1093> until <WG2193> the ninth <WG7067> hour, <WG5610>
the sun <WG2246> being obscured; <WG1587> and the veil <WG2665> of the temple <WG3485> was torn <WG4977> in two. <WG3319>

And Jesus, <WG2424> crying <WG5455> out with a loud <WG3173> voice, <WG5456> said, <WG3004> "Father, <WG3962> into Thy hands <WG5495> I commit <WG3908> My spirit. <WG4151>" And having said <WG3004> this, <WG3778> He breathed <WG1606> His last. <WG1606>

Now <WG1161> when the centurion <WG1543> saw <WG3708> what had happened, <WG1096> he [began] praising <WG1392> God, <WG2316> saying, <WG3004> "Certainly <WG3689> this <WG3778> man <WG444> was innocent. <WG1342>"

And all <WG3956> the multitudes <WG3793> who came <WG4836> together <WG4836> for this <WG3778> spectacle, <WG2335> when they observed <WG2334> what had happened, <WG1096> [began] to return, <WG5290> beating <WG5180> their breasts. <WG4738>

And all <WG3956> His acquaintances <WG1110> and the women <WG1135> who accompanied <WG4870> Him from Galilee, <WG1056> were standing <WG2476> at a distance, <WG3113> seeing <WG3708> these <WG3778> things. <WG3778>
And behold, <WG2400> a man <WG435> named <WG3686> Joseph, <WG2501> who was a member <WG1010> of the Council, <WG1010> a good <WG18> and righteous <WG1342> man <WG435>

(he had not consented <WG4784> to their plan <WG1012> and action <WG4234>), [a man] from Arimathea, <WG707> a city <WG4172> of the Jews, <WG2453> who <WG3739> was waiting <WG4327> for the kingdom <WG932> of God; <WG2316>
this <WG3778> man <WG3778> went <WG4334> to Pilate <WG4091> and asked <WG154> for the body <WG4983> of Jesus. <WG2424>

And he took <WG2507> it down <WG2507> and wrapped <WG1794> it in a linen <WG4616> cloth, <WG4616> and laid <WG5087> Him in a tomb <WG3418> cut <WG2991> into the rock, <WG2991> where <WG3757> no <WG3756> one <WG3762> had ever <WG3768> lain. <WG2749>
And it was the preparation <WG3904> day, <WG2250> and the Sabbath <WG4521> was about <WG2020> to begin. <WG2020>

Now <WG1161> the women <WG1135> who <WG3748> had come <WG4905> with Him out of Galilee <WG1056> followed <WG2628> after, <WG2628> and saw <WG2300> the tomb <WG3419> and how <WG5613> His body <WG4983> was laid. <WG5087>
And they returned <WG5290> and prepared <WG2090> spices <WG759> and perfumes. <WG3464> And on the Sabbath <WG4521> they rested <WG2270> according <WG2596> to the commandment. <WG1785>
